content: Located in the city of Gyeonggi-do, South Korea, near DMZ is a security tourist attraction built for the reunification of the peninsula. It was built in 1972. Linjin Pavilion is divided into 1 underground floor and 3 above ground floor. It is composed of North Korea Memorial Hall Unification Park and various monuments. Linjin Pavilion is also displayed outside the Tan that was used in the war. 12 kinds of military equipment such as Keroplanes are a safe place to visit, remembering the pain of war and division, filled with a strong desire for unity.

Linjin Pavilion is also near the 38th Line. There are visiting altars for people living in Korea but relatives in Korea to visit and hope for reunification. There are also exhibition halls of various materials and pictorials related to Korean military, political and social conditions. There are also war monuments in Linjin River area, U.S. military participation monuments, tanks and aircraft used in Korean war. In addition, there are Freedom Bridge, "Railway Dream Running (Jingyi Railway Interruption Point)" and the comfort tower for the martyred diplomatic envoys in Mt. Ongshan, Myanmar. It is a safe tourist destination with the bitterness of war and division in mind and a strong sense of desire for unity.

Linjin Pavilion is a non-military area near the 38th Front. It is said that many relatives separated by the war once looked at each other here and could visit it free of charge. They must go with the regiment.

A morning spent here, quite interesting content, the core of the Panmunjom, satisfied. The car left JSA and stopped by Linjin Pavilion Freedom Bridge, which used to be a place for exchange of Korean and Korean prisoners of war,   Freedom Bridge is the only bridge across the Jinjiang River in Korea,   after the signing of the agreement in 1953,   more than 13,000 war captors returned home through the bridge,   when they passed through the bridge, they shouted   "Long Live Freedom"160 from then on, they called him #160 Freedom; In 1998, the Unification Bridge was opened, and now it has become a bit withered. The old tin locomotive, the bridge deck with tens of meters left, the bridge head and the signature of the national flag on the wire net are many Korean relatives still in Korea praying for their families one day.

Linjin Pavilion is surrounded by altars overlooking home and expressing yearning for ancestors, as well as exhibition halls displaying more than 400 pieces of information and pictorials related to Korean military, political and social conditions, as well as war monuments in Linjin River area, US military participation monuments, tanks and aircraft used in Korean war. In addition, there are Freedom Bridge, "Railway Dream Running (Jingyi Railway Interruption Point)" and the comfort tower for the martyred diplomatic envoys in Ongshan, Myanmar, which are safe places of sightseeing bearing in mind the bitterness of war and division and permeating with a strong sense of desire for unity.

Linjin Pavilion is a large park, including some souvenir shops in the demilitarized zone. Our tour guide told us that they had a large festival in this park to commemorate families lost in the war. There were many modern sculptures to pray for peace, melancholy history and memorial halls.

There is a "Unified Prospect Station" that can look across the river through a telescope at the hilltop. But it's a few kilometers away from the border. Perhaps it's not North Korea at all. If you want to go deep into the 38th Line, the starting point of the official one-day tour is here.

The statue of Lee Shuchen is visited in the center of Seoul, Guanghuamen area, and you can see two huge statues of people in the middle of Guanghuamen Square, one of which is the stone statue of General Lee Shuchen. General Lee is said to be a 16th century North Korean naval general, he led the troops to defeat the Japanese invaders, for North Korea is a big national hero, so in Guanghuamen Square, you can see the very spectacular statue of General Lee.

War hero, Admiral Li Yanchen 6.5 meters high bronze statue is located in Guanghuamen Square in front of Gyeongboo Palace. The statue of the admiral is standing, with a sword in his right hand and a soldier's determination on his face. Near the statue is a miniature ghost ship representing the Admiral's command during the war. There is also a small museum to commemorate the Admiral. In front of the statue is a fountain known as "12.23", representing the Admiral's 23 battles won by 12 military ships. It is recommended to start your trip to Seoul from here, starting with the statue of Emperor Sejong and walking to the main palace. There is a nice free museum below the two statues to tell you the stories of these two great Koreans. Parts on Admiral Yi Xuan detail the Great Navel Battle, showing how he overcame difficulties from Japanese aggression to save South Korea, all thanks to strategy and better ship design. There are also true stories about David and Goliath.

The bronze statue of General Li Yanchen is the local history and culture. It is very famous and landmark square buildings. It can be seen from a long distance. It is located and spectacular. Many tourists stop to take pictures. There are many pigeons flying in the nearby square. It is great.

The statue of highly respected Admiral Yi Syn Shin that helps fight off the Japanese from occupying Joseon in year 1598. Given the title Chungmu (loyan and brave), his name will be remembered together with Korean history.

The Ming Dynasty flooded, in order to protect the country of Korea, the court gave blood. Li Rusong and other names personally hanged the handsome, and invested more than 100,000 troops in order to recapture most of the territory such as Pyongyang and Seoul for North Korea, and hit the Japanese dragonfly back to the sea. In the process of protesting the war, North Korea produced the most famous hero in their national history, Lee Shuchen. In fact, if the Ming Dynasty army had not resisted Japan and aided the DPRK, North Korea would have been destroyed by Japan more than 200 years earlier.

Li Shuchen, a famous general of the Korean dynasty. During the Japanese invasion of Korea, Li Shuchen defeated enemy forces at the time of the country's fall. Li Shuchen's bronze statue stands in Guanghuamen Square, with his left hand akimbo and his right hand arrow, which is extraordinary.

A bronze statue of General Lee Shunsen can be seen along the winding slope of Maobao Square. It is surrounded by 12 and 13 fountains. The fountain's name "12" represents 12 Korean warships in the Mingliang Sea War. They defeated the Japanese Navy in this war, and "23" represents the unbeaten achievement of General Li Shunsen in 23 battles. There are 200 fountains with fountains up to 18 meters in height. More than 100 dry pools and dry springs are changeable and varied. They seem to be reproducing the fierce naval battles of that year, as well as telling the brilliant life of the general. During the summer daytime, many citizens and tourists play in the fountain. The colorful lights at night make the fountain more beautiful and moving. There are also regular wonderful fountain shows.
